China aplicaría nuevas medidas para Hong Kong
Shen podría haber estado insinuando que Beijing podría estar preparándose a intervenir en el asunto al aprobar un decreto a través de la Asamblea Popular Nacional
01 Nov 2019, 00:56 by AP
BEIJING (AP) — China está comprometiéndose a impedir que potencias extranjeras interfieran en los asuntos de Hong Kong y lleven a cabo actos de “separatismo, subversión, infiltración y sabotaje”, afirmó el viernes un funcionario chino.
Un alto miembro de la Asamblea Popular Nacional de China, el parlamento ceremonial del país, hizo las declaraciones más recientes contra el presunto respaldo extranjero a los manifestantes antigubernamentales.




Shen Chunyao se refería a un documento del Partido Comunista en el que se afirma que Beijing “establecerá y fortalecerá un sistema legal y un mecanismo de ejecución para salvaguardar la seguridad nacional” en Hong Kong.
Hong Kong, que tiene un sistema legal independiente amparado por su propia Constitución, ya ha intentado implementar leyes para evitar la subversión, pero se ha topado con una oposición pública formidable.
Shen podría haber estado insinuando que Beijing podría estar preparándose a intervenir en el asunto al aprobar un decreto a través de la Asamblea Popular Nacional.

text:
China would apply new measures for Hong Kong
Shen could have been hinting that Beijing could be preparing to intervene in the matter by passing a decree through the National People's Assembly
01 Nov 2019, 00:56 by AP
BEIJING (AP) - China is pledging to prevent foreign powers from interfering with Hong Kong affairs and carrying out acts of "separatism, subversion, infiltration and sabotage," a Chinese official said Friday.
A senior member of the National People's Assembly of China, the country's ceremonial parliament, made the most recent statements against the alleged foreign support for anti-government protesters.




Shen Chunyao was referring to a document of the Communist Party in which it is stated that Beijing "will establish and strengthen a legal system and enforcement mechanism to safeguard national security" in Hong Kong.
Hong Kong, which has an independent legal system protected by its own Constitution, has already tried to implement laws to prevent subversion, but has encountered formidable public opposition.
Shen could have been insinuating that Beijing could be preparing to intervene in the matter by passing a decree through the National People's Assembly.






Hong Kong
